title: Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor on white laid paper
inscribed: Below left, pen and brown ink: da pauvre du [o] m. No. 115 ehi / No. 261 (?) [crossed out]
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Octagonal base supported by tapered feet. Front panel shows a relief of Hermes as shepherd, sleeping. Ram at left. Above, on dial, a peacock. A standing woman in profile at left. A pitcher at right. 

Inscriptions:
Below left, pen and brown ink: da pauvre du [o] m. No. 115 ehi / No. 261 (?) [crossed out]

Below center: Cooper Union stamp #457D

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25.Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor on white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-14.
